DataElement.preferredDefinition: The laboratory results of serum creatinine.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins._The breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, that is excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function.(NCI)_The clear liquid part of the blood that remains after blood cells and clotting proteins have been removed._The result of an action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The clear liquid part of the blood that remains after blood cells and clotting proteins have been removed.:The breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, that is excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function.(NCI)

Concepts.definition: The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins.
The breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, that is excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2/7/14 released DEC. tt 8/21/13 curated for imaging trials. tt

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A float number using the metric measure of milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A unit of mass concentration defined as the concentration of one milligram of a substance in unit volume of the mixture equal to one cubic deciliter or 100 cubic centimeters. It is also a unit of mass density (volumic mass) defined as the density of substance which mass equal to one milligram occupies the volume one cubic deciliter or 100 cubic centimeters.:A number that can have its decimal point in any position.

Concepts.definition: A unit of mass concentration defined as the concentration of one milligram of a substance in unit volume of the mixture equal to one cubic deciliter or 100 cubic centimeters. It is also a unit of mass density (volumic mass) defined as the density of substance which mass equal to one milligram occupies the volume one cubic deciliter or 100 cubic centimeters.
A number that can have its decimal point in any position.

ValueDomain.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 2/7/14 released VD. tt 9/6/13 curated to support imaging trials. tt

DataElement.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
